answers.answer: there are a LOT of reasons for leg pain from Neropathy from diabetes to a blood clot to a pinched nerve in your back.  go see an MD
If ecg shows BORDERLINE ECG. then does that show a sign of heart problem

You shoudn't let this go without an immediate in-person evaluation. Leg pain is often due to what is called intermittamnt claudication, which often develops in diabetics. They usually give you a color dopplar of the legs for differential diagnosis.  In the meantime improve circulation with omega-three supplements, two half-teaspoons of arginine (one half teaspoon every 12 hours) and magnesium supplements (500 mg a day). The reason you need an in-person exam is to rule out a clot.

question: Is severe leg pain in a diabetic and blood pressure patient a symptom of complications of heart? If so what are those please xplain anyone help
title: heart condition
